name: AaAaAA!!! - A Reckless Disregard for Gravity
description: BASE jump through a floating city, creating your own stunts to delight your fans. Use quick reflexes to negotiate the intricate tangle of girders that make up the floating city. Flip protesters off for points!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP/Vista Processor:1.5 GHz processor Memory:1GB Graphics:3D card with 128MB video memory DirectXÂ®: 9.0c

reviews.review_text: Here is a game that loses its appeal in about 30 minutes. Sure, the first 5 or 10 minutes you think the game is kinda cool, but by minute 15 you will have decided the game is a bit boring and repititous, by minute 30 you will have decided the game is no longer fun to play, and after 2 hours of game play you will think there are far better uses of Harddrive space than AaAaAA!!! - A Reckless Disregard for Gravity.

This is one of those games that you probably pulled out back when Steam used to do their sales events. Then you put it back away for a very long time. I don't blame you. It's fun for about 15 minutes, but then you just keep doing the same thing over and over again. There's only so much fun you can have in a game about jumping off buildings. Well....maybe that's not true, but there's only so much fun you can have in this game.  You start each round by jumping off a building. Points are scored for getting close to objects without hitting them, interacting with people (thumbs up or flipping off), flying through certain gates, and sticking your landing. This gameplay can only interest you for so long. The controls work well enough while falling, except controlling after deploying your parachute can be a little awkward.  The visuals are bright and intense, but not all that interesting. There are lots of flashing lights which could be problematic to some people. The music is fast and somewhat entertaining. Maybe the best part of the game.  I could not recommend this game for more than a few minutes playtime. Fire it up if you got it in a bundle, but you will quickly put it back away.  Grade: D+

My Take: A frantic paced game where you attempt to reach perfection on each level and will not rest until you have five stars. Rude gesture to all the protesters out there.   Graphics: Simple polygons, but everything is distinctive enough that you can make out what's what during high speeds.  Sound: Enough entertaining noises to distract you from how annoyed you are.  Music: Not good enough to listen to on its own, but well suits the pace of the game.  Controls: Standard look and movement bindings, but I should figure out better bindings for the other actions. I end up accidentally pressing a wrong key at inopportune times.  Did I Finish It: Not 100%, but I got to the end.  Will I Play it Again: Depends on how much content is in AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!!, which I have yet to play. It's is supposed to have the same levels remastered, so I'm going to say no.  Should You Buy It: If the above holds true, they're the same price so don't bother.
one of my favorite indie games on Steam, challenging but really fun to play with great atmosphere and music
not bad for the price. fast and addictive. it makes you want to replay the level over and over again.

Motion sickness, the game.   The title of the game is accurate. There's not a whole lot to say here - it's a well designed, simple concept that's extremely fun. I don't see myself playing this to the point of obsession, but I will definitely play until I unlock everything and see what else I can do with it.   For those of you who are like me, and entirely too afraid to actually participate in extreme sports like base jumping, this will confirm your belief that you're really not cut out for it. You will be perfectly satisfied to sit in your chair, breathe in through your nose, out through your mouth, and imagine yourself floating to the ceiling.   A fun little game that doesn't take itself too seriously, and has enough silly humor to make you smile - note that you won't laugh uproariously, but I don't believe that was the point of this, anyway.   Gameplay is top notch, soundtrack is fun and funny, and I will definitely enjoy any time period in which I play this game, but I seriously doubt I will get addicted to it. One of those rare gems that's worth anyone's time, even iff you just have a few minutes to kill. I, personally, enjoy games that don't require a huge time investment in order to understand what they're about and have fun with them, and this is definitely the type where your boredom will die for a bit.   Plus, after you play for an hour or so you'll exit and still feel like you're playing it.   Neat. 8/10.  (Small edit: I mean it's not very addictive. I meant to say that it was fun, but I don't see myself getting addicted to it. Fixed.)
Base jumping with a wingsuit for points. Can it get more exciting than that? No, unfortunately it can't.
Garish colors, grainy looks, lowres everything, and it even does not feel like you are falling.   Stay away at all costs.

A freestyle falling game where you're trying to score points by getting close to (but not running into) buildings. There's some interesting hidden things in some of the levels that you can try to collect, and the speed and difficulty increases as you unlock more levels. It's sort of mindless and you can zone out while playing. I wouldn't call it a stellar game, but if you have a few minutes to waste then this can work well enough.

It's like JSR mixed with skydiving. Gets repetitive because the whole game revolves around dodging blocks while free-falling with the occasional wall to spray paint or fan/critics to wave at. The only lasting appeal/replay value is trying to beat your friends leaderboard scores. Worth picking up in a bundle or on sale but definitely not worth the full price.
Game sucks.
Cool, I guess
The beta was jolly, the full game is jolly too.

It's a good game. Not great, but good. It hasn't aged terribly well and/or looks like a student's game, particularly with the models and random other images strewn throughout to try to distract you. There's a lot of replayability though, with leaderboards and really just trying to improve your own skills. It's not enough to keep me playing for that long, but it's a decent romp.

This game is surprisingly fun. Totally non-serious, and a fun, crazy concept. Jump of buildings, fall a long way, try not to get smashed, and get awarded in teeth! Crazy random fun. Good music, good comedy, a good distraction. Definitely worth picking up.
One of the most fun games ever. Challenging, fast and addictive, it's the perfect 'one more time' game

Having played through most of this game, I can safely say that I didn't enjoy a single minute of it.  The idea of base jumping through futuristic, laser-skyway cities has some definite appeal, but when it amounts to simply traversing around elongated blocks at a steady pace with some retro acid-trip inspired background trying to compete for eye focus, the product leaves you wanting.  The humor is 'LOL so randum XD' and the devs shamelessly plugged themselves into a number of levels. The game is basically built around high scores, in the same vein as classic arcade games. But when the leaderboards are dominated by hackers (a million points in the tutorial level? Please) with no moderation in sight, that takes out the possibility of an ePeen simulator.  One positive about this game is the level design. Some of the courses are really cunning, and I like game designers that twist and bend the rules of their own game to make a variety of new experiences.
SOOOO ADDICTING! Lots of levels, and random bits!
Meh. Potato hunting ruined this game for me, but you may enjoy it.
Very different and innovative, while building on a simple concept. You may not enjoy actually playing it very much, however (like myself), but the only way to find out is by playing it.

It doesn't look all that exciting, but it really is a lot of fun. The flavor news casts and videos add alot to the experience. Seemingly unhelpful tips like 'Look up when you're falling up' turn out to be good advice.
Makes you scream AaAaAAAAAAAGNASHIIIITNOOOAOUCH!! ...... ._.
thumbs up down....

This game kicks â¥â¥â¥. It has a very strange Jet Set Radio-like aesthetic, and it's very intense. If you like action games, this is a must-play. It's hard to describe, as base jumping isn't exactly a well-established video game genre, but it's very fun. Give it a shot, you won't be sorry.
8.99â¬ for this crap? WHAaHAaHAA - A Senseless Waste of Money.
fast paced mayham
I like this indie game, real trippy, amusing and requires some skill. Beware of seizures. :)
Vertical Burnout Don't shatter your skeleton Dive bomb all the birds

My Rating: 3 out of 4 Replayability: YES Achievements: 7 Multiplayer: No  What is this game about?   This is a base jumping simulator where players earn points for performing tricks across eighty unique levels. There are seven achievements with their own varying difficulty to attain. The only involvement with other players is the leaderboard. Storyline is told through in the level selection by the stoner radio host. In the level selection there are options you can choose that either tell you facts or show acid-trip cinematics with odd stories.  Is it fun?   Yes, the game will keep you busy for hours, but doing the same tricks on various layouts of levels will get old.
Exactly what it looks like. Do you find yourself finding the tallest mountains and buildings in games in order to fling yourself off them? Well, this is that game and nothing else. Bro.
This is the best game about intentionally breaking every bone in your body ever made.

'Vertigo is anguish to the extent that I am afraid not of falling over the precipice, but of throwing myself over,' Sartre said in Being and Nothingness. When I consider the possibility of me playing this game, I consider one of the possible possibilities not determined by a foreign cause, but by my own being instead. As someone who avoids death would avoid a precipice, I avoid anguish by nihiliating the possibility of me deciding to play this game anymore.   AaAaAAvoid this game!!!
Suprisingly sexy little game that combines falling, towerblocks and the kind of sense of humour I can jive with.
This is a great game unless you have acrophobia I guess
Amazing humour, best played with a joystick and mouse, and in 3D!

Forever at the front of alphabatized gaming lists, AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA! has no genre. It's radically different from most games, even other indie titles, and plays its individuality well-enough to actually be a good game. At times, the game feels a bit repetitive, but that's negated by it letting you SKYDIVE FROM FLOATING SKYSCRAPERS. This game induces adrenaline rushes at times, which is far more than can be said for a lot of games bar intense multiplayer games. Give aaAaAA a shot, even if you don't like it, you'll never experience a game that tries to do what it succeeds in doing.
Good clean fun, full of weirdness. Simple to pick up, hard to master, the way games should be.

AaAaAA!!! - A Reckless Disregard for Gravity is an average game built on a fairly unique concept of doing tricks while falling off fantasy suspended structures. While the game does feature a wide variety of playmaps and modes, and the unlocking and teeth currency system are welcome, the game has some pretty noticeable flaws. First and foremost is the lack of controller support, which given the twitch nature of the gameplay seems like a must. Secondly, the game does not feature any interesting music and the sound effects particularly for the parachute are quite poor. I had fun with this title for a few minutes, but the tedium grows as these flaws repeat over each game session. I would recommend this game only to action fans who want a novel concept but caution others to stay away.

A goofy game where you base jump through hoops while trying to flick people off. Punk style sense of humor and strange array of difficulty distrobution in the levels make this game interesting and fun. I beat most of them pretty quickly though.
Crazy and deserving of a lot of attention. Excellent vertical First Person strangeness!
This game could not be any more indie unless the developer cut himself in half. Seriously though the game isnât half bad and if getting gold medals gets your jimmies rusled then go all for it.

Jump from floating buildings and obtain points by going through rings, hoops, glass panes, etc. Collect teeth to unlock more levels and upgrades. Make sure you don't open your parachute too late or too early.

Falling through the air, getting kisses and hugs, thumbs up and middle finger all wrapped up in an addictive game. The music is perfect for the game, the offbeat sense of humour works. After all that, look at the price! WHY HAVEN'T YOU BOUGHT THIS YET?!
This game is awesome, you jump off of a rooftop and have to look cool on the way down.
Fun but not spectacular. Could use some environmental variety.

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a great game that i can imagine nobody has heard of. I got this game cheap with the potato sack and it has more than been worth it. Great game with a unique feeling and great fun.
This game is a REAL adrenaline rush a times. its also really funny. give a go, you wont be disapointed.
It's â¥â¥â¥â¥ flamethrowers meets zombie strippers with their â¥â¥â¥â¥ out. Thats how balls awsome this game is.

From the most disinterested newcaster, to the unusual guides to making cookies, AaAaAA!!! is a game that will pull you along for the fall (literally). You are a base jumper in a floating city the seems to have a 'â¥â¥â¥â¥ the government!' attitude, and you jump off buildings, falling close to other buildings to gain points. If this doesn't seem interesting to you then you need help.  You can graffiti buildings, flip off spectators, smash into birds, break through scoring glass, fly so close to rugged mountains that you'll lose your belly and â¥â¥â¥â¥ yourself laughing at some of the in-game antics.  Buy this game, you'll never regret it.
Good game to waste a bit of time. Didn't engage me for too long, though. I probably wouldn't pick up any of the extra levels. It is worth the money if you get it on sale.
An amazing game that you can spend as little as 5 minutes playing... or 5 hours. Can get difficult at times.
